summary:
Monty Python was a famous British comedy group formed in 1969. The six members—Graham Chapman, John Cleese, Terry Gilliam, Eric Idle, Terry Jones, and Michael Palin—created a popular TV show called *Monty Python's Flying Circus*. It was a unique sketch comedy series with funny characters and unusual humor.

They also made movies like *Monty Python and the Holy Grail* and *Life of Brian*, which are considered some of the best comedy films ever. Monty Python's work has influenced many other comedians and comedy shows. They received many awards for their funny and creative work.
title: Monty Python
